image.altText: Diesel submarine at a ship yard.

props.synopsis: A former senator says the documents are a sign the government is exploring the idea of dismantling nuclear submarines at shipyards in Adelaide's north-west, but the SA minister who attended the meeting says it was not the "focus" of the discussions.

title.children: Minister rejects claim talk about nuclear waste during UK trip signals plans for SA

image.altText: Police car with officer and leafy street with houses in background.

props.synopsis: Police have responded to reports of a shooting incident in Adelaide's north-east.

title.children: Man taken to hospital after allegedly being shot in leg

image.altText: An overhead shot of the Whyalla circular jetty

props.synopsis: The state and federal governments today announced they will dedicate a combined $30 million to the Whyalla airport, in addition to $3.14 million from the federal government to kick start the long-awaited foreshore development.

title.children: Major cash injection for Whyalla foreshore development and airport

image.altText: A police officer in uniform with a serious expression standing in front of a police logo

props.synopsis: Police say the alleged offenders had the wrong address and that the 18-year-old victim, who was shot in the leg, was not the intended target.

title.children: Six people arrested for attempted murder after allegedly shooting at 'wrong address'

image.altText: The exterior of a building with corrugated metal sheets and a bright red logo, reading APY Art Centre Collective

props.synopsis: The final investigation into allegations of interference in First Nations artwork has concluded, with the Indigenous corporation regulator saying no further action will be taken.

title.children: Investigation into 'white hands on black art' allegations concludes

image.altText: A koala looks down from the fork of a gum tree

props.synopsis: A sanctuary for up to 1,000 koalas and other wildlife is to be established on Kangaroo Island with the hope it will bring tourism and education opportunities while protecting the valuable population of marsupials.

title.children: New koala sanctuary plan for Kangaroo Island

image.altText: Adam Reilly - man with white shirt and Indigenous artwork tie looks ahead

props.synopsis: Adam Reilly has told a parliamentary inquiry it was not his decision to leave the Department for Child Protection and has called for changes to the system.

title.children: 'Hurtful rumours': Former SA child protection chief explains departure

image.altText: A metal sign on a building saying YOUTH COURT

props.synopsis: A teenage girl who had items of extremist material on her phone and school-issued laptop is just a "young, naive, Muslim girl with autism", a court has heard.

title.children: Muslim girl 'with autism' pleads guilty to possessing extremist material

image.altText: Peter Malinauskas announcing a cabinet reshuffle.

props.synopsis: A new artificial intelligence portfolio and changes to the Child Protection Minister's responsibilities have been revealed in a reshuffle of the Malinauskas government cabinet.

title.children: AI, autism and child protection in focus for Malinauskas cabinet reshuffle

image.altText: Dozens of bricks of drugs wrapped and laid out on a blue tarp

props.synopsis: Two young Victorian men who were involved in the attempted importation of more than 100 kilograms of cocaine into South Australia have been sentenced to three years in jail with a non-parole period of 18 months.

title.children: Pair labelled 'muppets' jailed over attempted 'astronomical' cocaine import

image.altText: A lone firefighter conducting a backburn.

props.synopsis: Residents living on the edge of the Grampians National Park, in the communities of Cavendish and Halls Gap, are told to prepare for difficult days ahead.

title.children: New threat to communities as Grampians fires close in

image.altText: Steve Alderson photo

props.synopsis: Golfer Steven Alderson made international headlines when he became the first winner with autism on the Golf for the Disabled Tour. He hopes to use his success to inspire others living with autism to chase their dreams.

title.children: Bullied golf champion Steve Alderson hopes to become a beacon for others living with autism

image.altText: Photos of skaters are placed on a table next to an ice rink.

props.synopsis: A pair of 16-year-old figure skaters, their mothers and two world champion coaches were among 14 members of the skating community on board the doomed flight.

title.children: Teen figure skaters and Russian coaches among US plane crash victims

image.altText: Emergency response teams assess airplane wreckage retrieved from a dark river at night.

props.synopsis: First responders have recovered the bodies of 28 passengers from the American Airlines jet that collided with the helicopter, US officials said.

title.children: Search for remaining bodies in Washington DC crash continues

image.altText: The red light of emergency service vehicles reflect across a dark river as personnel stand near the site of a plane crash.

props.synopsis: A military helicopter and passenger jet collided over the Potomac River in Washington DC on Wednesday.

title.children: Here's what we know about the American Airlines crash so far

image.altText: Dr Megan Brooks - woman with black jacket and blue shirt and short hair walks out of coroners court

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest has heard that multiple attempts to escalate an emergency response were made after a ramping-related death in Adelaide, but staff were told the situation did not meet the criteria.

title.children: Hospital boss's attempt to escalate emergency response after ramping-related death denied, court hears

image.altText: Diesel submarine at a ship yard.

props.synopsis: A former senator says the documents are a sign the government is exploring the idea of dismantling nuclear submarines at shipyards in Adelaide's north-west, but the SA minister who attended the meeting says it was not the "focus" of the discussions.

title.children: Minister rejects claim talk about nuclear waste during UK trip signals plans for SA

image.altText: A black-and-white image of a young man in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: An investigation has been launched as a mother fights for improved healthcare in her community following an ordeal she believes threatened her son's life.

title.children: Health minister apologises for 'distress' caused by teen's hospital care

image.altText: Salwan Momika dressed in a dark jacket and glasses

props.synopsis: Salwan Momika was facing four counts of agitating an ethnic group and a trial verdict had been due the day after his death

title.children: Man who burned Koran shot dead in Sweden

image.altText: A red and purple dragon puppet is held up by dancers

props.synopsis: Sydneysiders are welcoming in the Lunar New Year with events across the city, including dragon boat races, street festivals, lion dances and more. Here's what's on.

title.children: Fireworks, lion dances and street parties: Sydney's Lunar New Year events

image.altText: ASIO spy chief Mike Burgess

props.synopsis: Australia's terror threat level will remain at "probable" despite the disturbing discovery of a caravan packed with explosives and an alleged antisemitic plot to attack several targets.

title.children: Threat level to remain at 'probable' after alleged antisemitic terror plot

image.altText: A man wearing a collared shirt.

props.synopsis: A man claiming to own the Dural property linked to a counterterrorism investigation says police broke down the front door and handcuffed his tenant.

title.children: Dural property owner denies caravan links, alleges police roughness

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A man and a woman in blue spacesuits pose for a photo, smiling.

props.synopsis: Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams are supposed to come back to Earth in March, but it's unclear if they will return home sooner.

title.children: Stranded astronauts begin spacewalk as Trump asks SpaceX to 'go get' them

image.altText: sir chan in tie

props.synopsis: The last of Papua New Guinea's founding fathers and one of the country's longest serving politicians, Sir Julius Chan, has died.

title.children: Founding father and 'icon' of Papua New Guinea Sir Julius Chan dies at 85

image.altText: A woman pointing at her arm, with a red rash.

props.synopsis: Scratching an itch is almost irresistible — even though it can make a problem worse. Now researchers have discovered a mechanism that explains the "itch-scratch cycle".

title.children: 'Why does it feel so good?': Study reveals secrets of why we scratch

image.altText: Travis Head celebrates a catch as Angelo Mathews walks off

props.synopsis: Travis Head takes one of the best catches of his career as Australia takes three wickets in the final hour of day two to further turn the screws against Sri Lanka in the first Test in Galle.

title.children: Travis Head screamer caps another dominant day for Australia in Sri Lanka

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: The girl's then-employer has pleaded guilty to charges relating to sexual relationships she engaged in with her and two other separate victims.

title.children: Teenage girl groomed by employer tells court her 'innocence' was taken

image.altText: people swarm a white red cross van while carrying weapons

props.synopsis: The delicate ceasefire between Israel and Hamas has again been tested, after chaotic scenes in Gaza threatened to derail the most recent hostage handover.

title.children: Eight hostages freed from Gaza, Israel releases 110 Palestinian prisoners

image.altText: Serco

props.synopsis: The federal government's decision to change security contractors at centres around the country has left workers caught between the current and incoming operators.

title.children: Immigration detention workers plan strike action over redundancy dispute

image.altText: Four people in black blazer jackets walking from train underpass

props.synopsis: The 15-year-old is the second person to be charged over the alleged murder of a 25-year-old man in the NSW Illawarra region.

title.children: Teenage boy charged with murder over man's death outside train station

image.altText: strs_DuralCaravan_2909_3341

props.synopsis: NSW Police are investigating how explosives used to blast underground tunnels and quarries were found in a caravan parked in a quiet residential Sydney suburb.

title.children: What is the Powergel explosive found in back of a Sydney caravan?

image.altText: Pallbearers carry a coffin

props.synopsis: Police are still searching for the assailant behind the murder of a Melbourne underworld figure, but may face major barriers to apprehending those ultimately responsible.

title.children: As Sam Abdulrahim is laid to rest, the hunt for his killers ramps up

image.altText: A map of Australia shows several shaded patches indicating possible cyclones forming around Queensland and northern WA

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology is forecasting multiple cyclones could form across northern Australia by the end of the week, as tropical lows linger off the coast of north Queensland, in the Gulf of Carperntaria, and off the Kimberley in Western Australia.

title.children: Four potential cyclones forecast for Australia over coming days, BOM warns
